intro: Anthocleista insulana, commonly known as the Madagascar moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
